title: SoC THEATRE 241-2-20 Design Process: Costume Design I

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is the first in the Costume Design sequence at Northwestern. We will focus on the art of costume design not only in product but also in process. This will involve researching, discussions, analysis of dramatic text, in-class projects and out of class assignments, which will result in a series of student presentations and project critiques.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
1. Understand the fundamental elements and principles of design and utilize this vocabulary in critiques to give constructive visual feedback.

2. Be able to record visual insights through gestures, collages, and sketches.

3. Demonstrate the ability to research a play dramaturgically from a design point of view.

4. Demonstrate a growing understanding of design process.

5. Communicate research and design through drawing.

6. Conduct preliminary swatching of fabric from Vogue and other locations.

7. Have knowledge of and experience creating the various paper work submitted to a costume shop for the construction of costume designs.

8. Demonstrate the ability to articulate with growing sophistication their design ideas verbally and visually.
